description.narrative: Sustaining Peace in Bougainville - Enhance political dialgoue between the two Government and the two Parliments around the BPA agreement.

participating-org.narrative: United Nations Development Fund for Women
United Nations Fund for Population Activities

sector.narrative: Eradicate poverty in all its forms and dimensions

provider-org.narrative: United Nations Development Fund for Women

condition.narrative: Social and environmental sustainability will be enhanced through application of the UNDP Social and Environmental Standards (http://www.undp.org/ses) and related Accountability Mechanism (http://www.undp.org/secu-srm).
UNDP as the Implementing Partner will comply with the policies, procedures and practices of the United Nations Security Management System (UNSMS.)

comment.narrative:
Outcome Indicator 1.a: Number of joint communiques on BPA or referendum process issued by the two governments = 1 Outcome Indicator 1.b: Evidence of joint decisions by two Government on referendum questions, voter eligibility and appointment of chair for the BRC = Referendum questions, voter eligibility and BRC chair not agreed Outcome Indicator 1.c: Level of partnership between the national parliament and BHOR on the BPA and referendum supported by joint statements = Draft MoU for cooperation and collaboration exists Output Indicator 1.1.1 Frequency of JSB meetings and joint resolutions on the BRC and arrangements for the referendum = 1 Output Indicator 1.1.2 Proportion of joint JSB resolutions implemented by both GoPNG and ABG = 10% Output Indicator 1.1.3 Number of women leaders participating in JSB meetings = 1 Output Indicator 1.2.1 Parliamentary Partnership Agreement signed between the National Parliament and the BHOR for cooperation and collaboration = 0 Output Indicator 1.2.2 Number of public statements made by the speakers in support of a strengthened parliamentary partnership = 0 Output Indicator 1.2.3 Number of mission reports tabled in national parliament following bipartisan committee missions = 0 Output Indicator 1.2.4 Number of dialogues with the population on key political issues is enhanced through the Peace Implementation Forum, convening in each region. = 0 Output Indicator 1.3.1 NCOBA establishes a permanent presence in the AROB to facilitate the implementation of the BPA = 0 Output Indicator 1.3.2 Number of annual meetings held between the two Chief Secretaries = 2
Outcome Indicator 2.a: Increase in the proportion of women and youth with a sufficient understanding of the referendum = 26% Outcome Indicator 2.b: Improved understanding of

Output 1.1: JSB meets regularly and its resolutions are implemented jointly by the two (2) Governments Target: At least 65%
Output 1.2: The two Parliaments make joint decisions on the BPA and referendum process, including on post referendum. Target: 1 public statement by the Speaker. Target: 3 (mitigating measures, consultation process and team members identified)
Output 2.1: Both Governments agree on joint messages on the BPA, including referendum, and facilitate their dissemination. Target: 1,000 copies of joint messages distributed throughout Bougainville.
Output 2.2: Innovative and community led dialogues about a peaceful future for Bougainville. Target: 5,000 people directly reached.
Output 3.1: In partnership with DPAI, implementation of the recommendations of the weapons disposal report by the UN, including support to the set up and operation of a Joint Secretariat; identification of remaining weapons and monitoring of collection. Target: 1 resolution
Output 3.2: Support to the factional unification in Bougainville, including bringing the remaining outliers on board with the BPA and helping to implement and monitor the MOUs between the factions and the ABG. Target: three factions recognize and work with ABG to actively participate in the implementation of the peace process.
Output 3.3: Targeted support to disenfranchised youth, which may include support with community conversations, referral to trauma services, community development for improved social cohesion, support to war wounded. Target: 3 completed Youth Resource Centres providing services identified by regional youth associations.

January to July 2020
Output 1.1: JSB meets regularly and its resolutions are implemented jointly by the two (2) Governments Result: 1 JSB held in March 2020 with 12 meeting resolutions.
Output 1.2: The two Parliaments make joint decisions on the BPA and referendum process, including on post referendum. Result: 0
Output 2.1: Both Governments agree on joint messages on the BPA, including referendum, and facilitate their dissemination. Result: This was not achieved due to the Bougainville Regional elections, COVID and other factors
Output 2.2: Innovative and community led dialogues about a peaceful future for Bougainville. Result: This was not achieved due to the Bougainville Regional elections, COVID and other factors.
Output 3.1: In partnership with DPAI, implementation of the recommendations of the weapons disposal report by the UN, including support to the set up and operation of a Joint Secretariat; identification of remaining weapons and monitoring of collection. Result: Resolution minuted in the March 2020 JSB meeting
Output 3.2: Support to the factional unification in Bougainville, including bringing the remaining outliers on board with the BPA and helping to implement and monitor the MOUs between the factions and the ABG. Result: 1 faction was recognized. This faction is the Panguna Mekamui. They joined the Joint Weapons Disposal Secretariat in 2019 to become part of the peace process.
Output 3.3: Targeted support to disenfranchised youth, which may include support with community conversations, referral to trauma services, community development for improved social cohesion, support to war wounded. Result: The 3 youth resource centres were completed and officially handed over to the Secretary for Community Development in January 2020.
August to December 2020
Output 1: Key institutional and operational capacities at national and sub-national level are strengthened to support a successful post referendum process Result: Two vehicles procured to support NCOBA to effectively perform its coordination roles
Output 2: Increased awareness on the post referendum process and progress ensuring that both the population in and outside of Bougainville is informed Result: No joint key messages or awareness materials were released by ABG.
Output 3: Increased opportunities for an inclusive peaceful process for all stakeholders to participate in the Post Referendum Process and contribute to a future Bougainville
Indicator: 3.1.1 Outlier groups engage in post referendum process (SPB) Result = 3 different groups were engaged in Buin. They are the Mekamui 1 lead by Damien Koike, Mekamui 2 (those that have broken away from Mekamui 1) and Freedom Fighters.
Indicator: 3.1.2 Economic and Investment Summit leads to additional investment commitments and economic opportunities (SPB) Result = 0
Indicator: 3.1.3 Human Rights Forum develops a Bougainville Human Rights Action Plan (SPB) Result = 0
Indicator: 3.1.4 Human Rights are monitored during the post referendum period by the Human Rights and Gender BHOR committee forming a yearly report (SPB) Result = 0

Outcome Indicator 1.a: Number of joint communiques on BPA or referendum process issued by the two governments = 2 (through the JSB) Outcome Indicator 1.b: Evidence of joint decisions by two Government on referendum questions, voter eligibility and appointment of chair for the BRC = Decision on Voter Eligibility made Outcome Indicator 1.c: Level of partnership between the national parliament and BHOR on the BPA and referendum supported by joint statements = Output Indicator 1.1.1 Frequency of JSB meetings and joint resolutions on the BRC and arrangements for the referendum = At least 2 JSB meetings Output Indicator 1.1.2 Proportion of joint JSB resolutions implemented by both GoPNG and ABG = 20% of 2019 JSB resolutions implemented Output Indicator 1.1.3 Number of women leaders participating in JSB meetings = 2 Output Indicator 1.2.1 Parliamentary Partnership Agreement signed between the National Parliament and the BHOR for cooperation and collaboration = Parliamentary Partnership Agreement signed Output Indicator 1.2.2 Number of public statements made by the speakers in support of a strengthened parliamentary partnership = 1 Output Indicator 1.2.3 Number of mission reports tabled in national parliament following bipartisan committee missions = 1 Output Indicator 1.2.4 Number of dialogues with the population on key political issues is enhanced through the Peace Implementation Forum, convening in each region. = 3 Output Indicator 1.3.1 NCOBA establishes a permanent presence in the AROB to facilitate the implementation of the BPA = NCOBA has a presence in ARoB Output Indicator 1.3.2 Number of annual meetings held between the two Chief Secretaries = 2
Outcome Indicator 2.a: Increase in the proportion of women and youth with a sufficient understanding of the referendum = Outcome Indicator 2.b: Improved understanding of BPA and its pillars by the wider Bougainville population = Output Indicator 2.1.1 Bi-monthly meetings convened by both governments through the BRC Transitional Committee to discuss key messages and their dissemination = 1 Output Indicator 2.2.1 Number of awareness sessions conducted by the Department of Community Government at the district level = 13 Output Indicator 2.2.2 Number of radio dramas on the BPA produced and aired across Bougainville and Papua New Guinea = 5 Output Indicator 2.2.3 Number of BPA and referendum awareness sessions staged outside of Bougainville = 2
Outcome Indicator 3.a: Weapons disposal process completed and a safe and secure environment provided for conduct of the Bougainville referendum = Outcome Indicator 3.b: Outlier factions accepting and cooperating in the weapons disposal process = Outcome Indicator 3.c: All communities around the last factions become part of the weapons disposal process and benefitting from reintegration = Output Indicator 3.1.1 The two governments agree through a JSB resolution on the political conditions for the successful collection of weapons = 1 Resolution Output Indicator 3.1.2 Level of knowledge gained by CSOs, CBOs, Community Governments, women, youth and churches on weapons disposal as a key pillar of the BPA and of arms collection processes = 10% Output Indicator 3.1.3 Number of Arms collection centres established and number of weapons collected and recorded = 1 Output Indicator 3.1.4 Number of EOD teams trained and deployable to undertake EOD activities pre and post-referendum = 1 Output Indicator 3.2.1 All outlier factions sign and implement an MoU/MoA or declaration of intent to participate in the implementation of the peace process = 1 faction Output Indicator 3.2.2 Women and Youth Participate in weapons disposal efforts disaggregated by age and sex = 50% Output Indicator 3.2.3 Successful reconciliations between former fighting factions in Bougainville and with the PNG Government = 1 Output Indicator 3.3.1 Number of community reinsertion programmes targeting localities with outlying factions = All constituencies are declared referendum-ready Output Indicator 3.3.2 Number of targeted community-based reinsertion programmes for engagement on weapons disposal carried out = Joint Weapons Disposal Secretariat includes Meekamui as part of its membership

Outcome Indicator 1.a: Number of joint communiques on BPA or referendum process issued by the two governments = 1 JSB in March at which 14 resolutions were made Outcome Indicator 1.b: Evidence of joint decisions by two Government on referendum questions, voter eligibility and appointment of chair for the BRC = JSB of March 2019 set the referendum date at October 12, 2019 Outcome Indicator 1.c: Level of partnership between the national parliament and BHOR on the BPA and referendum supported by joint statements = Output Indicator 1.1.1 Frequency of JSB meetings and joint resolutions on the BRC and arrangements for the referendum = Output Indicator 1.1.2 Proportion of joint JSB resolutions implemented by both GoPNG and ABG = Output Indicator 1.1.3 Number of women leaders participating in JSB meetings = Output Indicator 1.2.1 Parliamentary Partnership Agreement signed between the National Parliament and the BHOR for cooperation and collaboration = Output Indicator 1.2.2 Number of public statements made by the speakers in support of a strengthened parliamentary partnership = Output Indicator 1.2.3 Number of mission reports tabled in national parliament following bipartisan committee missions = Output Indicator 1.2.4 Number of dialogues with the population on key political issues is enhanced through the Peace Implementation Forum, convening in each region. = Output Indicator 1.3.1 NCOBA establishes a permanent presence in the AROB to facilitate the implementation of the BPA = Output Indicator 1.3.2 Number of annual meetings held between the two Chief Secretaries =
Outcome Indicator 2.a: Increase in the proportion of women and youth with a sufficient understanding of the referendum = Outcome Indicator 2.b: Improved understanding of BPA and its pillars by the wider Bougainville population = Output Indicator 2.1.1 Bi-monthly meetings convened by both governments through the BRC Transitional Committee to discuss key messages and their dissemination = The BRC Transitional Committee does not exist anymore since the operationalization of the Bougainville Referendum Commission in 2018, therefore this Committee has not met in 2019. However, The two governments have developed sets of key messages which have now been endorsed for dissemination. With new updates on definitions of the options for the referendum, these key messages will be updated accordingly to cater for these updates Output Indicator 2.2.1 Number of awareness sessions conducted by the Department of Community Government at the district level = 8 achieved through the 1st Joint Roadshow Initiative. The objective of the joint roadshow was for people in the three regions of Bougainville to hear firsthand from GoPNG and ABG leaders, key information pertaining to the progress of the referendum under the banner of “Peace by Peaceful means” Output Indicator 2.2.2 Number of radio dramas on the BPA produced and aired across Bougainville and Papua New Guinea = 3 Radio Drama series were produced however stakeholder review recommended a revision to the episodes thus a Consultation workshop is scheduled to be held in early July to inform the rewriting of the scripts. Output Indicator 2.2.3 Number of BPA and referendum awareness sessions staged outside of Bougainville = Output Indicator 2.3.1 Number of jointly approved messages disseminated via SMS through mobile phones across AROB = Output Indicator 2.3.2 Media practitioners have an increased awareness and knowledge of the BPA and referendum process = 1 Media Dialogue on Conflict-Sensitive Reporting was held in April with 19 (Male: 12; Female: 7) Media Practitioners from the national and local media outlets in attendance. 90% of the participants acknowledged a change in their understanding of the Bougainville peace process Output Indicator 2.3.3 Increased awareness by PNG population in the effective implementation of the BPA through regular forums =

Output 1.1: JSB meets regularly and its resolutions are implemented jointly by the two (2) Governments Target: At least 65%
Output 1.2: Key government institutions with responsibilities for BPA implementation and coordination between the two governments are enabled to implement their functions effectively. Target: Parliamentary Partnership Agreement in place for cooperation and collaboration between the National Parliament and the BHOR
Output 2.1: Both Governments agree on joint messages on the BPA, including referendum, and facilitate their dissemination. Target: 1,000 copies of joint messages distributed throughout Bougainville.
Output 2.2: Innovative and community led dialogues about a peaceful future for Bougainville. Target: 5,000 people directly reached.
Output 3.1: In partnership with DPAI, implementation of the recommendations of the weapons disposal report by the UN, including support to the set up and operation of a Joint Secretariat; identification of remaining weapons and monitoring of collection. Target: 1 resolution
Output 3.2: Support to the factional unification in Bougainville, including bringing the remaining outliers on board with the BPA and helping to implement and monitor the MOUs between the factions and the ABG. Target: three factions recognize and work with ABG to actively participate in the implementation of the peace process.
Output 3.3: Targeted support to disenfranchised youth, which may include support with community conversations, referral to trauma services, community development for improved social cohesion, support to war wounded. Target: 3 completed Youth Resource Centres providing services identified by regional youth associations.

Output 1: Key institutional and operational capacities at national and sub-national level are strengthened to support a successful post referendum process Result: Two vehicles procured and handed over to NCOBA on April 2021, assisting to effectively perform NCOBAs coordination role
Output 1.1: JSB meets regularly and its resolutions are implemented jointly by the two (2) Governments Result: 3 JSB meetings held in 2021. One JSB meeting was held on 5 February 2021 in Arawa, Bougainville, another JSB meeting on 5 July 2021 in Wabag, Enga province and final one on 9 December 2021 in Port Moresby.
Output 1.2: Key government institutions with responsibilities for BPA implementation and coordination between the two governments are enabled to implement their functions effectively. Result: Logistical and operational support is provided to the two governments to proceed with political consultation dialogue. The ratifcation process is still being discussed through JSB, JTT and joint political consultation dialogue meetings.
Output 2: Increased awareness on the post referendum process and progress ensuring that both the population in and outside of Bougainville is informed Result: Joint Communication Working Group, comprised of ABG and NCOBA officers are continuing working on joint key messages, awareness raising and communication strategy.
Output 2.1: Both Governments agree on joint messages on the BPA, including referendum, and facilitate their dissemination. Result: Joint Communication Working Group, comprised of ABG and NCOBA officers are continuing working on joint key messages, awareness raising and communication strategy.
Output 2.2: Innovative and community led dialogues about a peaceful future for Bougainville. Result: Community led Transition Dialogues have reached a total of 6552 individuals, nearly 49% of them women and 35% of them are young people in 2021.
Output 3: Increased opportunities for an inclusive peaceful process for all stakeholders to participate in the Post Referendum Process and contribute to a future Bougainville
Indicator: 3.1.1 Outlier groups engage in post referendum process (SPB) Result = 3 different groups were engaged in Buin. They are the Mekamui 1 lead by Damien Koike, Mekamui 2 (those that have broken away from Mekamui 1) and Freedom Fighters.
Indicator: 3.1.2 Economic and Investment Summit leads to additional investment commitments and economic opportunities (SPB) Result = The Summit date is currently not confirmed and delayed to a later period in 2022. The Summit will provide a forum for key stakeholders to discuss the economic and investment activities and potential of the ARoB and chart a roadmap
Indicator: 3.1.3 Human Rights Forum develops a Bougainville Human Rights Action Plan (SPB) Result = 1 Human Right Forum is conducted in December 2021, with engagement of key CSOs, ABG officers
Indicator: 3.1.4 Human Rights are monitored during the post referendum period by the Human Rights and Gender BHOR committee forming a yearly report (SPB) Result = The key ABG officers (30 participants, 14 women) were sensitized on Human Rights Framework through a training, conducted on 5-6 August 2021 in Buka, AROB. Follow-up work is continiued to implement human rights framework, indicating key responsibilities of Government institution to protect and observe human rights in Bougainville.
Output 3.1: In partnership with DPAI, implementation of the recommendations of the weapons disposal report by the UN, including support to the set up and operation of a Joint Secretariat; identification of remaining weapons and monitoring of collection. Result: This output indicator is completed in previous phase of the Project.
Output 3.2: Support to the factional unification in Bougainville, including bringing the remaining outliers on board with the BPA and helping to implement and monitor the MOUs between the factions and the ABG.
Result: 1 faction was recognized. This faction is the Panguna Mekamui. They joined the Joint Weapons Disposal Secretariat in 2019 to become part of the peace process.
Output 3.3: Targeted support to disenfranchised youth, which may include support with community conversations, referral to trauma services, community development for improved social cohesion, support to war wounded.
Result: Up to 40 young men and women from Konnou Constiuency have received training on conflict prevention, peacebuilding, security awareness and financial literacy. Further follow-up work on implementing peacebuilding initiatives of youth from Konnou will be undertaken in 2022.

Target 2022 Output 1.1: JSB meets regularly and its resolutions are implemented jointly by the two (2) Governments Target: At least 65%
Output 1.2: Key government institutions with responsibilities for BPA implementation and coordination between the two governments are enabled to implement their functions effectively. Output Indicator 1.2.2: Number of MPs and ABG staff inducted on human rights, gender equality, inclusive peacebuilding Target: Up to 60 MPs and ABG staff trained on human rights, gender equality and inclusive peacebuilding
Target: 1,000 copies of joint messages distributed throughout Bougainville.
Output 2.2: Innovative and community led dialogues about a peaceful future for Bougainville. Target: 5,000 people directly reached.
Output 3.1: Advancing implementation of inclusive BPA and post-referendum process through engaging outlier groups with respect to gender and human rights Target: 15% increase in level of knowledge by Government officials on key pillar of the BPA, post referendum processes, gender and human rights centred peacebuilding Target: 10% increase in confidence level among women, youth and church members on post-referendum processes Output 3.2: Support two governments to host the Bougainville Economic Investment Summit considering needs of the outlier communities Target: Economic Investment is successfully conducted and Summit resolutions are endorsed by both Governments
